ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Hello, new bard (level 3) and well met to all!
ygData.msgSnippet: Guess that wouldn t help then :-). Didn t realize the default was Pet Taunt = On. ...    /pet taunt toggles the pets taunt on and
ygData.messageBody:
Guess that wouldn't help then :-). Didn't realize the default was Pet
Taunt = On.

--- "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...> wrote:

<HR>
<html><body>
<tt>
/pet taunt toggles the pets taunt on and off.  The default is on.<BR>
<BR>
Rokenn<BR>
<BR>
-----Original Message-----<BR>
From: Talien Sparrowsong [mailto:talien@...]<BR>
Sent: Monday, April 09, 2001 3:21 PM<BR>
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com<BR>
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Hello, new bard (level 3) and well met to all!<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
What does /pet taunt do?<BR>
<BR>
-Talien<BR>
<BR>
On Mon, 9 Apr 2001, John Grady wrote:<BR>
<BR>
> One comment on your macro Matt. Since VI is changing assist back
again,<BR>
> the seperate /pet attack command isn't needed right? How about<BR>
> substituting /pet taunt to try to reduce the damage to your
party.<BR>
> <BR>
> Tzeetch<BR>
> <BR>
> --- Matt DeBarger <mattdeba@...> wrote:<BR>
> <BR>
> <HR><BR>
> <html><body><BR>
> <tt><BR>
> Charming in a group is the best thing to do on a 2 pull even if there
is<BR>
> a<BR><BR>
> chanter.  Once you get good, the mob will be doing 90% of
its damage<BR>
> on the<BR><BR>
> party's main target, 10% on you.  Thats a great tradeoff to
0-10%<BR>
> damage<BR><BR>
> done to chanter/healer and mana spent mezzing.<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> Here is my "pet assist" hotkey, it works
great.  Rule 1,<BR>
> let the group know<BR><BR>
> what you're doing, and make sure its ok with the enchanter. 
Most are<BR>
> happy<BR><BR>
> for the mana you save them.  Type A enchanters will not be
happy, so<BR>
> then<BR><BR>
> just let them mez the mob...<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> Ok 2 Pull comes, assist the puller and find out what mob he is<BR>
> killing.<BR><BR>
> Target the non targeted mob and hit charm, once it sticks (very
low<BR>
> resists<BR><BR>
> if you have a good CHA) hit the "pet assist"
hotkey.<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> Once you get this down its easy to weave 2 other songs while
doing<BR>
> this...<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> "Pet Assist"<BR><BR>
> /pet back off<BR><BR>
> /assist <main assist name><BR><BR>
> /pause 3<BR><BR>
> /pet attack<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> The pet back off is not necesaary, but seems to help. 
Sometimes<BR>
> charms mobs<BR><BR>
> will still attack other party members or pets, the pet back off
will<BR>
> prevent<BR><BR>
> this.  It also lets the party know what you have charmed,
since your<BR>
> pet<BR><BR>
> will say something.  THe down side is the second or so of
melee you<BR>
> lose<BR><BR>
> from your pet while he is waiting for the attack
command.<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> As a side not, /pet back off, is probably the best mem blur spell
in<BR>
> the<BR><BR>
> game.<BR><BR>
> <BR><BR>
> </tt><BR>
> <BR>
> <br><BR>
> <BR>
